p.s: In the following I will comment on the impact that the movie had on me and the impact it can have on other viewers.
The movie did not have a big impact on me but I think it can have it on other people.
For me the movie was interesting but not eye-opening.
I think I'm a well-informed person in regards to social unequality and political topics.

This may be the cause why the perspectives shown in the movie weren't that new for me, but still I think the movie is a good visualization of struggles black teenagers have growing up in systems that discriminate them.
I think this visualization can have a quite strong impact on people not that well-informed.
The film presents a serious and important topic to the viewer but in a Hollywood-like way, so it can be seen and understood by most people.
It is made to let the viewer feel with Starr and see her struggles which can be seen by analyzing the movie and although it is a movie for the mainstream it doesn't lose the seriousness the book had.
I also want to say something to the publishing year, because I think if I watched the movie in 2018 it would have had a stronger impact on me.
In just three years the Black lives matter demonstrations grew to a level, which was never reached before so the world was confronted with the topic of systematic racism.
That's why I think the movie had a big impact when it was first published.
So the movie can, as proven in my comment, have an impact on people and show them other perspectives, but for me it didn't do or have that.
